thread.title: Manchester United ace Ibrahimovic hails 'quiet' Martial | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Manchester United ace Ibrahimovic hails 'quiet' Martial | Daily Mail Online

author: Anthony Hay For Mailonline
title: Manchester United ace Ibrahimovic hails 'quiet' Martial | Daily Mail Online
text: comments Zlatan Ibrahimovic has heaped praise on team-mate Anthony Martial following the Frenchman's man-of-the-match display against Watford on Saturday. Jose Mourinho brought the 21-year-old in from the cold to start at the weekend and the former Monaco man delivered by scoring and claiming an assist. Martial, who joined Manchester United in September 2015 for a fee which could rise to Â£58million, had been out of favour during the past few weeks but Ibrahimovic insists he has always remained a true professional. Anthony Martial (centre) celebrates with Juan Mata and Henrikh Mkhitaryan after scoring The Frenchman netted Manchester United's second goal against Watford on Saturday Ibrahimovic, speaking to Manchester United's official website , said of Martial: 'When he plays, he is playing well. 'He isn't a guy that speaks a lot; he is quiet and very professional. He always tries to do his best, trains hard and that is paying off, just like in this match. 'I think it depends on every individual and what kind of person they are and their approach, how open he is. It is different for every person. 'He is not going around with his head down. He is training hard, he gives a lot of energy and he wants to play, which is normal. RELATED ARTICLES
